output_questions.question: Static position
output_questions.explanation: The `top` property has no effect because `position: static` is the default and ignores offset properties.

output_questions.question: Relative move
output_questions.explanation: The div is shifted 30px to the right from its normal position.

output_questions.question: Absolutely positioned
output_questions.explanation: The span is placed 50px from the top and 100px from the left of its first positioned ancestor or the document body.

output_questions.question: Fixed box
output_questions.output: Fixed box
output_questions.explanation: The div is always fixed to the bottom-right corner of the viewport, even when scrolling.

output_questions.question: Sticky box
output_questions.output: Sticky box
output_questions.explanation: The div will 'stick' to the top of its container when you scroll past it, staying 10px from the top.

output_questions.question: Right aligned
output_questions.explanation: The div is absolutely positioned 20px from the right edge of its containing block.

output_questions.question: Move up
output_questions.explanation: The div is moved 15px up from its normal position.

output_questions.question: Inner
output_questions.output: Inner
output_questions.explanation: The inner div is absolutely positioned relative to the outer div.

output_questions.question: Fixed top-left
output_questions.output: Fixed top-left
output_questions.explanation: The box remains at the top-left of the viewport, 20px from each edge, regardless of scrolling.

output_questions.question: On top
output_questions.output: On top
output_questions.explanation: A very high `z-index` ensures this div appears above most other elements.

output_questions.question:
Div above
Span below
output_questions.output:
Div above
Span below
output_questions.explanation: The div is stacked above the span because of the higher z-index.

output_questions.question: Bottom right
output_questions.output: Bottom right
output_questions.explanation: The box is positioned 10px from the bottom and right of its containing block.

output_questions.question: Sticky header
output_questions.explanation: The div will stick to the top of its parent when scrolling.

output_questions.question: Centered absolute
output_questions.output: Centered absolute
output_questions.explanation: The box is horizontally centered absolutely using left/right 0 and margin auto.

output_questions.question: Move 25% right
output_questions.explanation: The paragraph is shifted 25% of its containing block to the right.
